meanings.definition: Exhausted or tired from physical or mental exertion.
meanings.sent1: After a long day of hiking, I felt fatigued and just wanted to rest.
meanings.sent2: She looked fatigued after staying up all night studying for her exam.
meanings.sent3: The marathon runner was so fatigued, he accidentally put his shoes on the wrong feet.
meanings.sent4: The old car sputtered to a stop, its engine fatigued from years of use.
meanings.sent5: The students' faces were pale and fatigued after the challenging math test.

meanings.definition: To cause to be tired or exhausted.
meanings.sent1: The long hike fatigued my legs, and I could barely walk the next day.
meanings.sent2: Staying up late to finish the project fatigued him, but he was proud of the result.
meanings.sent3: The chef fatigued his arm whisking the batter for the cake.
meanings.sent4: The constant noise from the construction site fatigued the residents in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent5: The repetitive tasks fatigued the worker, making him yearn for a change in routine.
